meanings.sent1: The blearier picture was hard to see clearly.
meanings.sent2: The fog made everything look blearier than usual.
meanings.sent3: The blearier mirror made her reflection seem like a ghost.
meanings.sent4: His memory of the event became blearier as time passed.
meanings.sent5: The blearier outline of the mountain faded into the distance.

meanings.definition: Covered with a film or haze
meanings.sent1: Her glasses were so dirty, they became even blearier.
meanings.sent2: The window was blearier after the rain left streaks on it.
meanings.sent3: The blearier film on the camera lens distorted the photos.
meanings.sent4: The blearier mist over the lake gave it a mysterious look.
meanings.sent5: The blearier layer of dust on the book made it hard to read the title.

meanings.definition: To make or become dim or indistinct
meanings.sent1: The fog began to blearier the view of the city.
meanings.sent2: She tried to blearier the details of the painting to create a dreamy effect.
meanings.sent3: The magician used smoke to blearier the boundaries of reality.
meanings.sent4: The tears in her eyes started to blearier her vision.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a soft brush to blearier the edges of the portrait.
